item.title: William add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Laughter and tears are both responses to frustration and exhaustion. I myself prefer to laugh, since there is less cleaning do to do afterward." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: William add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Like so many Americans, she was trying to construct a life that made sense from things she found in gift shops." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: William add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description:
"To be is to do - Socrates
To do is to be - Sartre
Do Be Do Be Do - Sinatra" -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: William add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut, Jr.
item.description: "Thanks to TV and for the convenience of TV, you can only be one of two kinds of human beings, either a liberal or a conservative." -- Kurt Vonnegut, Jr.

item.title: William add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Much of the conversation in the country consisted of lines from television shows, both past and present." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: William add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "I learned this, at least, by my experiment: that if one advances confidently in the direction of his dreams, and endeavors to live the life which he has imagined, he will meet with a success unexpected in common hours." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: William add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "What lies behind us and what lies ahead of us are tiny matters compared to what lives within us." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: William add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "If a man does not keep pace with his companions, perhaps it is because he hears a different drummer. Let him step to the music he hears, however measured or far away." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: William add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "Do not be too moral. You may cheat yourself out of much life so. Aim above morality. Be not simply good, be good for something." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: William add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "Most men lead lives of quiet desperation and go to the grave with the song still in them." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: William add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "It's not what you look at that matters, it's what you see." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: William add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "Our life is frittered away by detail. Simplify, simplify." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: William add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "Read the best books first, or you may not have a chance to read them at all." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: William add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "Rather than love, than money, than fame, give me truth." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: William add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "There is no remedy for love, but to love more." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: William add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "I would rather sit on a pumpkin, and have it all to myself, than be crowded on a velvet cushion." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: William add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "As if you could kill time without injuring eternity." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: William add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "This world is but a canvas for our imagination." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: William add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "A man is rich in proportion to the number of things which he can afford to let alone." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: William add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "The cost of a thing is the amount of what I will call life which is required to be exchanged for it, immediately or in the long run." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: William add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "Men have become the tools of their tools." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: William add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "Every generation laughs at the old fashions, but follows religiously the new." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: William add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description:
"It is not enough to be industrious; so are the ants. What are you industrious about?"
[<i>Letter to Harrison Blake</i>; November 16, 1857]" -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: William add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "Do not hire a man who does your work for money, but him who does it for love of it." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: William add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "I can alter my life by altering my attitude. He who would have nothing to do with thorns must never attempt to gather flowers." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: William add a quote by Henry D. Thoreau
item.description: "You cannot dream yourself into a character: you must hammer and forge yourself into one." -- Henry D. Thoreau

item.title: William add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "Time is but the stream I go a-fishing in" -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: William add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "Beware of all enterprises that require new clothes." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: William add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "What does education often do? It makes a straight-cut ditch of a free, meandering brook." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: William add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "To a philosopher all news is gossip, and they who edit and read it are old women over their tea." -- Henry David Thoreau
